Sri Mulyani Akui Penerimaan Negara Masih Seret
04 Nov 2019, 11:14 by Hendra Kusuma


Foto: Istimewa

Jakarta - Di tengah ketidakpastian global yang memberikan dampak terhadap perekonomian Indonesia, Menteri Keuangan Sri Mulyani Indrawati mengaku bahwa penerimaan negara masih dalam masa sulit. Padahal kinerja APBN 2019 hanya menyisakan satu bulan lagi.Menteri Keuangan Sri Mulyani Indrawati mengatakan ketidakpastian global memberikan dampak pada beberapa sektor industri di tanah air. Beberapa industri yang terdampak merupakan salah satu penyetor besar penerimaan negara."Artinya kalau perusahaan mengalami tekanan, sehingga penerimaan atau lebih mereka menurun, maka pembayaran pajak mereka juga akan menurun," kata Sri Mulyani di ruang rapat Komisi XI DPR, Jakarta, Senin (4/11/2019).Sayangnya, Mantan Direktur Pelaksana Bank Dunia ini tidak menyebutkan berapa penerimaan negara yang sudah dikantongi Pemerintah hingga saat ini. Target penerimaan negara ditargetkan Rp 2.165,1 triliun di tahun 2019. Tercatat, Pemerintah telah mengumpulkan penerimaan sebesar Rp1.189,28 triliun hingga Agustus 2019. Jumlah ini setara dengan 54,93 persen dari target."Kita lihat setiap sektor mengalami pelemahan akibat dari ekonomi tersebut. Industri manufaktur bahkan mengalami growth negatif dari sisi penerimaan pajak," jelas dia.Berdasarkan data Kementerian Keuangan hingga akhir September 2019 atau kumulatif, beberapa realisasi penerimaan pajak dari industri pengolahan turun 3,2 persen menjadi Rp 245,6 triliun dibandingkan periode yang sama tahun sebelumnya.Realisasi penerimaan pajak dari sektor konstruksi dan real estat turun 1,2 persen atau menjadi Rp 56,2 triliun. Selanjutnya, sektor pertambangan yang turun 20,6 persen menjadi Rp 43,2 triliun. Sedangkan sektor perdagangan menyetor Rp 176,2 triliun atau melambat 2,8 persen.Lalu sektor jasa keuangan dan asuranai melambat 4,9 persen menjadi Rp 120,6 triliun. Hanya sektor transportasi yang penerimaannya tumbuh 18,9 persen menjadi Rp 36,3 triliun.Penerimaan negara semakin seret setelah PNBP juga mengalami penurunan yang cukup besar yakni 9,5 persen hingga akhir September 2019. Setoran PNBP SDA Nonmigas juga mengalami penurunan 9,2 persen.Sri Mulyani bilang, sumber penerimaan PNBP SDA dikarenakan menguatnya nilai tukar rupiah terhadap solar Amerika Serikat (AS) serta penurunan harga acuan minyak mentah Indonesia (ICP), serta beberapa penurunan harga komoditas seperti batubara.Tidak hanya itu, ketidakpastian global juga memberikan dampak terhadap aliran modal baik jangka pendek dan menengah masuk ke Indonesia dan juga neraca perdagangan."Neraca perdagangan kita sangat dipengaruhi destinasi market, kombinasi harga melemah menjadi terkena dua kali pukulan, terlihat non migas, dan migas bahkan alami defisit perdagangan impor kita melebihi dari ekspor. Sehingga dari neraca migas yang negatif sulit sangat positif, inilah yang mendesari pemerintah melakukan program B20," ungkap dia. Sri Mulyani Admits State Revenue Still Sluggish
Nov 04 2019, 11:14 by Hendra Kusuma


Photo: Special

Jakarta - In the midst of global uncertainty that has an impact on the Indonesian economy, Minister of Finance Sri Mulyani Indrawati admitted that state revenue was still in a difficult time. Whereas the performance of the 2019 APBN only leaves one more month. Minister of Finance Sri Mulyani Indrawati said global uncertainty had an impact on several industrial sectors in the country. "Some affected industries are one of the big depositors of state revenue." This means that if companies experience pressure, so that their revenues or more decline, their tax payments will also decline, "Sri Mulyani said in the DPR Commission XI meeting room, Jakarta, Monday (4 /11/2019).Unfortunately, the Former Managing Director of the World Bank did not mention how much state revenue has been pocketed by the Government to date. The state revenue target is targeted at Rp 2,165.1 trillion in 2019. Noted, the Government has collected revenues of Rp1,189.28 trillion as of August 2019. This amount is equivalent to 54.93 percent of the target. "We see that each sector experienced a weakening due to the economy. The manufacturing industry has even experienced negative growth in terms of tax revenue, "he explained. Based on data from the Ministry of Finance until the end of September 2019 or cumulative, some tax revenue realization from the processing industry fell 3.2 percent to Rp 245.6 trillion compared to the period same year before. Realization of tax revenues from the construction and real estate sector fell 1.2 percent or to Rp 56.2 trillion. Furthermore, the mining sector fell 20.6 percent to Rp 43.2 trillion. While the trade sector deposited Rp 176.2 trillion or slowed 2.8 percent. Then the financial services and insurance sector slowed down 4.9 percent to Rp 120.6 trillion. Only the transportation sector whose revenue grew 18.9 percent to Rp 36.3 trillion. The country's revenue has increasingly dragged down after PNBP also experienced a significant decline of 9.5 percent until the end of September 2019. Non-oil and gas PNBP SDA payments also decreased 9.2 percent Sri Mulyani said, the source of PNBP SDA revenue was due to the strengthening of the rupiah against the United States (US) diesel fuel and the decline in the Indonesian crude oil reference price (ICP), as well as some price cuts for commodities such as coal. Not only that, global uncertainty also had an impact on both short and medium term capital flows into Indonesia and also the trade balance. "Our trade balance is strongly influenced by destination markets, the combination of prices weakens to be hit twice, be seen non-oil and gas and even our natural trade deficit exceeds that of exports. from a negative oil and gas balance which is difficult to be very positive, this is what drives the government m "B20 program," he said.
